docs.snippet: GEITHNER--Peter Franz, died peacefully on July 29, 2016, at home in Orleans, Massachusetts with his children and grandchildren in his presence. Born July 14, 1932 to Paul H. Geithner and Henriette Schuck Geithner in Philadelphia, he graduated with...
docs.lead_paragraph:
GEITHNER--Peter Franz,

died peacefully on July 29, 2016, at home in Orleans, Massachusetts with his children and grandchildren in his presence. Born July 14, 1932 to Paul H. Geithner and Henriette Schuck Geithner in Philadelphia, he graduated with a B.A. from Dartmouth College in 1954 and served for four years as a Naval Aviator. After receiving an M.A. from the Johns Hopkins School of Advanced International Studies, Peter joined Columbia Carbon International and then spent six years at the U.S. Agency for International Development in Zimbabwe, Zambia (then the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland) and Washington, DC. He worked for almost three decades at the Ford Foundation, where helped shape programs in support of education, public health, human rights, and economic development. At the Ford Foundation, he served as the Deputy Representative for India, the Representative for Southeast Asia, Program Officer in Charge of Developing Country Programs, and the Foundation's first representative in China. Peter served as advisor to the Asia Center at Harvard University, China Medical Board, Japan Foundation Center for Global Partnership, Rockefeller Brothers Fund, and other organizations. He served on the Boards of the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations, China Center for Economic Research, Center for the Advanced Study of India, and other organizations. He was devoted to his colleagues and friends throughout the world and to their aspirations and causes. With his family, he shared his love of basketball and tennis, the ocean, and chocolate, commitment to public service, and fascination with the broader world. Peter was married for 54 years to Deborah Moore Geithner until her death in 2014. He is survived by his brother Paul H. Geithner, Jr., his son Timothy and his wife Carole, his daughter Sarah, his son Jonathan and his wife Debora, his son David and his wife Christine; and his grandchildren, Elise, Benjamin, Kaiya, Lincoln, Peter, Clare, Caroline, Piya and Malee.

docs.snippet: ANDERSON--Joan, 76, beloved mother of Emlie, mother-in-law of Juan, sister of Robert and David Bassman, passed away on June 19, 2016 at St. Luke's Hospital. Joan was an energetic, dynamic, caring person who lived life to the fullest, whether trave...
docs.lead_paragraph:
ANDERSON--Joan,

76, beloved mother of Emlie, mother-in-law of Juan, sister of Robert and David Bassman, passed away on June 19, 2016 at St. Luke's Hospital. Joan was an energetic, dynamic, caring person who lived life to the fullest, whether traveling the world, listening to opera, or devouring her favorite hamburger and chocolate shake lunch. She attained an M.A. from Hunter College in English and worked for Unique Homes Magazine for over 20 years as their advertising sales manager. She was preceded in death by her daughter Kimberly, sister Leslie Ginther, partner Jill Morris, companion Tracey Forrest and husband Vern Anderson. She leaves behind many loved ones and friends who cared deeply for her. Services will be held at the Church of the Blessed Sacrament, 152 W. 71st St., New York, NY 10023 on Wednesday, August 3rd at 10:45am. Donations in memory of Joan may be made to the National Kidney Foundation or your charity of choice.

docs.snippet: FICHANDLER--Zelda Diamond. September 18, 1924- July 29, 2016. Producer, Director, Teacher, Mentor, Sister, Mother, Grandmother, Wife. A small reception for friends and family will be held at Zel's D.C. home on August 3, 2016 from 3-8pm. A larger c...
docs.lead_paragraph:
FICHANDLER--Zelda

Diamond. September 18, 1924- July 29, 2016. Producer, Director, Teacher, Mentor, Sister, Mother, Grandmother, Wife. A small reception for friends and family will be held at Zel's D.C. home on August 3, 2016 from 3-8pm. A larger celebration of her life is planned for September 26, 2016 at Arena Stage. Donations to either the Allen Lee Hughes Diversity Fellowship or the Tom Fichandler Award c/o Arena Stage. Hal and Mark Fichandler
